page.title: 15SAMLESBURY HALL TODAY
page.content: The Hall is now used as a centre for buying and selling antiques, with a percentage of the proceeds going towards the upkeep of the building and grounds. There is also a clothes and crafts department operating on the same principle.A nature trail has been drawn up, which covers the extensive gardens and a small nature reserve on the other side of the adjacent A677. One area is used by the Bowmen of Pendle and Samlesbury, who run a very successful club with a large following. The Hall and original outbuildings are believed to have had a quadrangular lay out, but there is no present evidence of this. A more recent stableblock was converted for staff accomodation and the caretaker lives in a comparatively modern gatehouse.
